text: Diasemiopsis ramburialis is a moth of the family Crambidae. It occurs in most of Europe and the tropics, including the Azores, Fiji, New Zealand and Australia. The wingspan is 17–22 mm. Adults are speckled grey or brown, with two broad ragged white lines across each wing. The larvae possibly feed on Brassica species. ==References== Category:Spilomelinae Category:Lepidoptera of Cameroon Category:Moths of Japan Category:Moths of Europe Category:Moths of Réunion Category:Moths of New Zealand Category:Moths of Turkey Category:Moths of Africa Category:Moths described in 1834
title: Diasemiopsis ramburialis
